body_html:
Hello,

About the cudnn 6.0 compatibility, is it already working? I am trying tensorflow installation from source and I have got the error:

Please specify the location where cuDNN library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]:
Invalid path to cuDNN 6.0.21 toolkit. Neither of the following two files can be found:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/libcudnn.so

The OS is ubuntu 16.04, CUDA 8.0 and used anaconda for python 2.7

The OS is ubuntu 16.04, CUDA 8.0 and used anaconda for python 2.7
body:
Hello, 

About the cudnn 6.0 compatibility, is it already working? I am trying tensorflow installation from source and I have got the error:

> Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Invalid path to cuDNN 6.0.21 toolkit. Neither of the following two files can be found:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/libcudnn.so

The OS is ubuntu 16.04, CUDA 8.0 and used anaconda for python 2.7
